note.p: Firework maker. His father, Ralph Fenwick (1787/8–1847), was a firework artist in Lambeth from 1839. The company supplied the fireworks on the occasion of Queen Victoria’s accession, 1837, and at the end of the Crimean War, 1856. Killed, with seven others, by an explosion at his premises.
Census returns of England and Wales 1841 (The National Archives: Public Record Office HO107/1058/15/43/6), 1851 (HO107/1572/384/2)
England, select births and christenings, 1538–1975 (Ancestry.com, accessed 27 March 2017)

p.hi: London, England, Church of England deaths and burials, 1813–1980
